visit_type: Urgent care visit for ankle sprain

expected_issues.description: Fracture care billed when X-rays show no fracture

documents.content: 29-year-old male presents with left ankle sprain after twisting ankle playing basketball yesterday. Moderate swelling and tenderness over lateral malleolus. Able to bear weight with pain. X-ray of left ankle performed: NO FRACTURE IDENTIFIED. Diagnosis: Left ankle sprain, grade II. Treatment: RICE protocol, ace wrap, ibuprofen 600mg TID, crutches for comfort. Follow up if not improving in 1 week.
LEFT ANKLE 3 VIEWS: No acute fracture or dislocation. No joint effusion. Soft tissue swelling noted laterally. Bones are intact. IMPRESSION: Soft tissue swelling consistent with sprain. No fracture.

line_items.description: Radiologic examination, ankle; complete, minimum of 3 views
Closed treatment of bimalleolar ankle fracture
